name: Transient Erythroblastopenia of Childhood (TEC)
chief_complaint: My child has been pale and tired for the past few weeks
prognosis: Excellent, typically resolves within 1-2 months without sequelae
description: A temporary suppression of red blood cell production in otherwise healthy children, typically occurring between 6 months and 4 years of age. The exact cause is unknown but may follow viral infections. Distinguished from other anemias by its transient nature and absence of other cell line abnormalities.
